title: Understanding Self-Disclosure
text: Self-disclosure is a key concept in therapeutic relationships. It involves sharing personal information in a way that is appropriate and beneficial to the therapeutic process.

title: Context of Self-Disclosure
text: Consider the context in which self-disclosure occurs. It is not just about sharing information, but doing so in a way that models behavior for others.

hintAnswer: an interactive communication process wherein one person shares information about themselves in an appropriate context, modeling the behavior for others in the therapeutic relationship
title: Defining Self-Disclosure
text: What is the definition of self-disclosure in a therapeutic context?
choices: an interactive communication process wherein one person shares information about themselves in an appropriate context, modeling the behavior for others in the therapeutic relationship
>a process of sharing any information without considering the context
>a $$one-way$$ communication where only the therapist shares information
